snippet: The rare apology came a day after officers stripped and beat a man two blocks from the palace of President Mohamed Morsi during clashes between protesters and riot police officers.
abstract: Egypt's government offers rare apology after officers are seen on television beating naked man near presidential palace; spectacle of beating revives fury at Egypt's police force and serves as reminder that nearly two years after ouster of former Pres Hosni Mubarak, Pres Mohamed Morsi has taken few steps to reform police.

byline.original: By KAREEM FAHIM and MAI AYYAD

lead_paragraph: The rare apology came a day after officers stripped and beat a man two blocks from the palace of President Mohamed Morsi during clashes between protesters and riot police officers.

headline.main: Egypt’s Government Apologizes After a Beating Is Televised
headline.print_headline: Egypt’s Government Apologizes After a Beating Is Televised

keywords.value: Middle East and North Africa Unrest (2010- )
